types.name: AdvertSearchApplicableFilters

Filter option data that can be used to build various filters
        that can be applied to the current advert search results returned
        when performing an advert search query

types.name: AdvertSearchInput
types.description: Advert search arguments for building an ElasticSearch query.

inputFields.name: advertIds
inputFields.description: Request specific adverts by ID rather than query on advert attributes.

inputFields.name: bookingDateFrom
inputFields.description:
Minimum date for booking availability. Specific to adverts for services
          that accept date-based reservations, such as hotels, tours, or events.

inputFields.name: bookingDateTo
inputFields.description:
Minimum date for booking availability. Specific to adverts for services
          that accept date-based reservations, such as hotels, tours, or events.

inputFields.name: brandIds
inputFields.description: IDs of desired brands. See the Brand data type for more details.

inputFields.name: brandSlug
inputFields.description:
Brand name as represented by a partial URL path with spaces replaced by '-'.
          Must match a brand name saved in the database and search index.

inputFields.name: conditions
inputFields.description: The conditions of the product being advertised.

inputFields.name: countryIds
inputFields.description:
IDs of the desired countries (i.e. where the sellers are based).
          See the Country data type for more details.

inputFields.name: durationPeriod
inputFields.description: Indicates how long the advertised event or holiday lasts.

inputFields.name: genders
inputFields.description: Gender for whom the product is intended.

inputFields.name: locationSlug
inputFields.description:
Location name, usually a city, as represented by a partial URL path with spaces replaced by '-'.
          Must match an indexed location name.

inputFields.name: maxPriceCents
inputFields.description: Query adverts by maximum price denominated in cents.

inputFields.name: minPriceCents
inputFields.description: Query adverts by minimum price denominated in cents.

inputFields.name: optionValueIds
inputFields.description:
IDs of desired option values (e.g. 'red', 'large').
          See the OptionValue data type for more details.

inputFields.name: postcode
inputFields.description: The desired postcode, which matches according to the seller's address

inputFields.name: productIds
inputFields.description: IDs of the desired advert templates (i.e. products). Mostly used to search by model year.

inputFields.name: keywordQuery
inputFields.description: Search advert text fields with one or more keywords.

inputFields.name: regionName
inputFields.description:
For searching by region or state. Must be the abbreviation
          of the region/state name (e.g. use 'VIC', not 'Victoria').

inputFields.name: regionSlug
inputFields.description: Region, state, or province name as represented by a partial URL path with spaces replaced by '-'.

inputFields.name: saleTypes
inputFields.description: The ways in which the good or service can be purchased and collected.

inputFields.name: searchDistance
inputFields.description:
When location is included in the search, the radius (in kilometers
          or miles depending on country) from the geographic center of the queried location.

inputFields.name: searchType
inputFields.description: Whether your searching for adverts by retailer or by individual adverts.

inputFields.name: sellerIds
inputFields.description: IDs of the desired sellers. See the Seller data type for more details.

inputFields.name: sortBy
inputFields.description: The attributes by which results can be sorted.

inputFields.name: taxonId
inputFields.description: ID of the desired taxon. See the Taxon data type for more details.

inputFields.name: taxonSlug
inputFields.description: Taxon name as represented by a partial URL path with spaces replaced by '-'.

inputFields.name: taxonType
inputFields.description: Based on the taxonType of the associated Taxon.

inputFields.name: updatedSince
inputFields.description: Only return adverts which have been updated since this date

enumValues.name: SOONEST
enumValues.description:
For adverts with dates and/or times, start with the advert
          whose date/time is closest to now followed by adverts further in the future.

enumValues.name: CHEAPEST
enumValues.description: Start with the advert with the lowest price.

enumValues.name: MOST_EXPENSIVE
enumValues.description: Start with the advert with the highest price.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: Put adverts that are on sale at the top of results.

enumValues.name: LATEST
enumValues.description: Start with the most-recently-created advert followed by older adverts.

enumValues.name: ALPHABETICAL
enumValues.description: Sort alphabetically from numbers to 'a' to 'z'.

enumValues.name: ALPHABETICAL_DESC
enumValues.description: Sort alphabetically from 'z' to 'a' to numbers.

enumValues.name: NEAREST
enumValues.description:
For searches that include location parameters, use the ElasticSearch relevance score,
          but include proximity of the seller to the queried location to calculate that score
          (closer seller equals higher score).

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description:
The order of advert results when a sort type isn't specified.
          Put featured adverts at the top, ordering featured and non-featured adverts
          by the ElasticSearch relevance score.

types.name: AdvertSearchTypeEnum
types.description: Determines the shape of the results data.

enumValues.name: RETAILER
enumValues.description: Search results are aggregated by seller.

enumValues.name: ADVERT
enumValues.description: Search results are returned as individual adverts.

The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.description: The src URL for the image.

args.name: width
args.description: Desired width (in pixels) of image.

args.name: height
args.description: Desired height (in pixels) of image.

args.name: fit
args.description: Resize Fit Mode: default is max

types.name: ImageFitEnum
types.description: The resize fit mode - See: https://docs.imgix.com/apis/url/size/fit

enumValues.name: clamp
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the width and height dimensions without cropping or distorting the image, and the remaining space is filled with extended pixels from the edge of the image. The resulting image will match the constraining dimensions. The pixel extension is called an affine clamp, hence the value name, "clamp".

enumValues.name: clip
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the width and height boundaries without cropping or distorting the image. The resulting image will match one of the constraining dimensions, while the other dimension is altered to maintain the same aspect ratio of the input image.

enumValues.name: crop
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fill the width and height dimensions and crops any excess image data. The resulting image will match the width and height constraints without distorting the image. It's used in conjunction with the the crop parameter, which controls how the image is cropped. Both the w and h parameters will also need to be set.

enumValues.name: facearea
enumValues.description: Finds the area containing all faces, or a specific face in an image, and scales it to specified width and height dimensions. Can be used in conjunction with faceindex to identify a specific face, as well as facepad to include additional padded area around the face to zoom out from the immediate area around the faces.

enumValues.name: fill
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the requested width and height dimensions while preserving the original aspect ratio and without discarding any original image data. Excess space is filled with a solid color or blurred version of the image. The resulting image exactly matches the requested dimensions.

enumValues.name: fillmax
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the requested width and height dimensions while preserving the original aspect ratio and without discarding any original image data. If the requested width or height exceeds that of the original, the original image remains the same size. The excess space is filled with a solid color or blurred version of the image. The resulting image exactly matches the requested dimensions.

enumValues.name: max
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the width and height dimensions without cropping or distorting the image, but will not increase the size of the image if it is smaller than the output size. The resulting image will maintain the same aspect ratio of the input image.

enumValues.name: min
enumValues.description: Resizes and crops the image to match the aspect ratio of the requested width and height. Will not exceed the original width and height of the image.

enumValues.name: scale
enumValues.description: Scales the image to fit the constraining dimensions exactly. The resulting image will fill the dimensions, and will not maintain the aspect ratio of the input image.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
